column2: Amazon Web Services (AWS) loves Kubernetes and is officially "all in" on the open source container orchestration project.

column1: Given that 63% of Kubernetes cloud workloads already run on AWS
column2: coupled with AWS's stated goal of enabling maximum developer choice
column3: it was perhaps a foregone conclusion that AWS would roll out Amazon Elastic Compute Service for Kubernetes (EKS)
column4: a managed Kubernetes service to rival those already offered by Microsoft and Google.

column1: They are in the process of creating a service that will take the pain out of cluster management and integrate it with their managed Kubernetes service.

column2: and AWS commands much more developer fealty than Kubernetes does (impressive as Kubernetes' community is). is).
